lead_paragraph: Top-ranked Roger Federer, No. 3 David Nalbandian and No. 5 Andy Roddick advanced to the quarterfinals of the Rome Masters yesterday. Federer dispatched 14th-seeded Radek Stepanek of the Czech Republic, 6-1, 6-4, in 56 minutes, while Nalbandian beat Alberto Martin of Spain, 7-5, 6-4, for his eighth straight victory. Roddick knocked out Britain's Greg Rusedski, 7-6 (4), 6-2.
